unnormalised: Cardiology, at its core, is the branch of medicine dealing with the heart and blood vessels – the entire cardiovascular system. Common conditions that cardiologists address include coronary artery disease (CAD), heart failure, arrhythmias (irregular heartbeats), and valvular heart disease. Dr. Rao at AIIMS Delhi is a leading expert in interventional cardiology.

Doctor Rao at A-I-I-M-S Delhi is a leading expert in interventional cardiology.

unnormalised: One of the most frequently asked questions I receive is about the symptoms of a heart attack. While chest pain is the classic symptom, it's important to remember that it can manifest differently in individuals. Some may experience discomfort in the left arm, jaw, or back. Shortness of breath, nausea, and lightheadedness are other common signs. Time is of the essence – seeking immediate medical attention, preferably within the "golden hour," can significantly improve outcomes. Call 108 for an ambulance in such situations.

unnormalised: Diagnosing heart conditions involves a variety of tests. An ECG (electrocardiogram) is a simple, non-invasive test that records the electrical activity of the heart. An echocardiogram uses sound waves to create an image of the heart, allowing doctors to assess its structure and function. For more detailed information, a CT scan or MRI of the heart may be ordered. A stress test, often conducted on a treadmill, helps evaluate how the heart functions under physical exertion. Rs. 2500 is approximately the cost for an echocardiogram at many clinics.
normalised: Diagnosing heart conditions involves a variety of tests. An E-C-G (electrocardiogram) is a simple, non-invasive test that records the electrical activity of the heart. An echocardiogram uses sound waves to create an image of the heart, allowing doctors to assess its structure and function. For more detailed information, a C-T scan or M-R-I of the heart may be ordered. A stress test, often conducted on a treadmill, helps evaluate how the heart functions under physical exertion. Rupee two thousand five hundred is approximately the cost for an echocardiogram at many clinics.

unnormalised: Treatment options in cardiology are diverse, ranging from lifestyle modifications to complex surgical procedures. Medications play a crucial role in managing many heart conditions. Statins, for example, help lower cholesterol levels, while ACE inhibitors are used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. For CAD, angioplasty with stent placement is a common procedure to open blocked arteries. CABG (Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting) surgery may be necessary in more severe cases. My colleague, Dr. Sharma, successfully performed 3 CABG surgeries last week.
normalised: Treatment options in cardiology are diverse, ranging from lifestyle modifications to complex surgical procedures. Medications play a crucial role in managing many heart conditions. Statins, for example, help lower cholesterol levels, while A-C-E inhibitors are used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. For C-A-D, angioplasty with stent placement is a common procedure to open blocked arteries. C-A-B-G (Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting) surgery may be necessary in more severe cases. My colleague, Doctor Sharma, successfully performed three C-A-B-G surgeries last week.

unnormalised: Prevention is always better than cure. Adopting a healthy lifestyle is paramount for maintaining heart health. This includes a balanced diet low in saturated and trans fats, regular physical activity (at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise most days of the week), maintaining a healthy weight, and avoiding smoking. Monitoring blood pressure and cholesterol levels regularly is also essential, especially after the age of 40.

unnormalised: Several government initiatives in India aim to improve cardiovascular health awareness and access to care. The National Programme for Prevention and Control of Cancer, Diabetes, Cardiovascular Diseases and Stroke (NPCDCS) focuses on early detection and management of these conditions. Campaigns promoting healthy lifestyles and reducing risk factors are also underway. Free heart check-up camps are often organised on 14/11 which is celebrated as Children's day.

Campaigns promoting healthy lifestyles and reducing risk factors are also underway. Free heart check-up camps are often organised on fourteenth November, which is celebrated as Children's day.

unnormalised: In conclusion, understanding the basics of cardiology is vital for everyone, especially in India where heart disease is prevalent. By being aware of the symptoms, diagnostic tests, treatment options, and preventive measures, you can take proactive steps to protect your heart health. Consult a cardiologist if you have any concerns, and remember that early detection and intervention can make a significant difference. Take care and be heart smart!
